memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getVisible

briefdescription.para: Return the visible state for the entire command object.

detaileddescription.para: Returning false from this method removes the entire set of commands from the specified host.

parameterdescription.para: The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: Whether to instantiate the commands for this host or not

memberdef.argsstring: (in sbIPlaylistCommandsContext aContext)
memberdef.name: setContext

briefdescription.para: Be informed when a set of commands are attached to a playlist element.

detaileddescription.para: When a playlist element is about to use an sbIPlaylistCommands instance, after it has been duplicated, the element will pass a context to this method. The implementor may save the context information (for instance, a reference to the playlist on which the commands are to act) for later reference and use.

parameterdescription.para: The context object

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getNumCommands

briefdescription.para: Return the number of command elements to be displayed.

detaileddescription.para: The implementor should return the number of commands to be created
The other functions will be called in turn with the index value that represents each specific command element

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The number of commands to be created

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandType

briefdescription.para: Return the type of the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: Each command id has a type, these can be 'action', 'separator', 'value', and 'submenu'.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The string for the command id

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandId

briefdescription.para: Return the id string for the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: Each command id should be unique within this commands object. The visual style of the command can be set in the CSS.
Some id strings are parsed to create different objects:
"*separator*" - Create a menuseparator or an empty box

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The string for the command id

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandText

briefdescription.para: Return the human readable text for the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: If the string begins with an "&" character, the remaining portion of the string will be used as an index into the current localization's properties file.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The string for the displayed text

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandFlex

briefdescription.para: Return the flex value for the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: For instance, you can make your "*separator*" element have a flex of 1 and then right-justify all the command buttons after it. By default, command buttons will adjust their width to the width of their human readable text.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The value for the flex

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandToolTipText

briefdescription.para: Return the human readable text for the requested command element's tooltip.

detaileddescription.para: If the string begins with an "&" character, the remaining portion of the string will be used as an index into the current localization's properties file.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested

xrefdescription.para: The tooltip functionality is disabled because mozilla will crash if you delete an element currently displaying a tooltip.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The string for the tooltip

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandEnabled

briefdescription.para: Return the enabled state for the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: When the selection of the playlist changes state, or the tree is rebuilt, this method will be called to allow the code to enable or disable commands based upon the state of the playlist.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: True if the command should display as enabled

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandVisible

briefdescription.para: Return the visible state for the requested command element index.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: True if the command should be visible

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandFlag

briefdescription.para: Return the value of the flag for the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: The requested elements are always of type 'flag'

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The value for the flag

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandValue

briefdescription.para: Return the value of the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: The requested elements are always of type 'value'

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The value for the command

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aChoiceMenu, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandChoiceItem

briefdescription.para: Return the selected item for choice list of the requested command element index.

detaileddescription.para: The requested elements are always of type 'choice'

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The id of the choice item

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandShortcutModifiers

briefdescription.para: Return the shortcut modifiers of the requested command element index.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The shortcut modifiers for the command

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandShortcutKey

briefdescription.para: Return the shortcut key of the requested command element index.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The shortcut key for the command

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandShortcutKeycode

briefdescription.para: Return the shortcut keycode of the requested command element index.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: The shortcut keycode for the command

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandShortcutLocal

briefdescription.para: Return a boolean reflecting the local vs window-wide behavior of the shortcut.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: Whether the shortcut is local or not

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: getCommandSubObject

briefdescription.para: Return an sbIPlaylistCommands secondary object.

detaileddescription.para: If this method returns a valid interface, all other callbacks for this command item are bypassed.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the data is being requested
The index of the element for which the data is being requested
The type of object hosting the command

simplesect.para: An sbIPlaylistCommands interface to a secondary command object

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost, in AString aID, in nsIDOMDocument aDocument)
memberdef.name: instantiateCustomCommand

briefdescription.para: Instantiate the custom element associated with the requested command.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the item needs to be instantiated
The index if the command whose instantiation is being requested
The type of object hosting the command
The id of the custom command whose instantiation is being requested
Document in which to instantate element

simplesect.para: The custom element that has been instantiated

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost, in AString aID, in nsIDOMNode aCustomCommandElement)
memberdef.name: refreshCustomCommand

briefdescription.para: Refresh the custom element associated with the requested command.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the item needs to be refreshed
The index if the command whose refresh is being requested
The command host type that made the request
The id of the custom command element whose refresh is being requested
The element that needs to be refreshed

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aSubMenu, in PRInt32 aIndex, in AString aHost, in AString aId, in AString aValue)
memberdef.name: onCommand

briefdescription.para: Handle the fact that a command was activated.

detaileddescription.para: When the user activates the command button or menuitem, this method will be called with the event generated.

parameterdescription.para: The submenu for which the command was triggered
The index of the command that was triggered
The type of object hosting the command
The id of the command that was triggered
The optional value associated with the triggering of the command, or an empty string.

briefdescription.para: Duplicate the command object.

detaileddescription.para: When a command object is to be given to a playlist, the object registered with sbIPlaylistCommandsManager will have this method called. The method should be implemented like this:
It creates a new object instance and copies the methods and data over to it.

In addition, if your object contains more objects whose data should not be shared between command instantiation contexts, then these objects should be duplicated as well (otherwise, their data will be shared between duplicated instances). In this case, the duplicate method should be implemented something like this:
In case of more complex objects, you may need to create a recursive duplication method.

simplesect.para: A new copy of this object

memberdef.argsstring: (in AString aHost)
memberdef.name: initCommands

briefdescription.para: Initialization function.

detaileddescription.para: When a command object is duplicated and about to be used by a command instantiator, the instatiator first calls the init() method on it.

parameterdescription.para: The instantiator's host type (menu, toolbar, ...)

briefdescription.para: Shutdown function.

detaileddescription.para: When a command instantiator is done with a command object, it calls its shutdown() method before removing it from its internal lists.

briefdescription.para: An interface that represents the set of command buttons and context menu items available on a displayed playlist.

detaileddescription.para: This interface is meant to be implemented by user code.

Implementors that create their own specific database libraries and playlists (eg: sbIDeviceBase) may also specify a commands object to be shown when the tables are displayed in a <playlist> element. This object's purpose is to return abstract information that can be used by the playlist element to autogenerate its xul button and menuitm elements.

These objects ought to be created in javascript. When a new playlist is created, it will query sbIPlaylistCommandsManager for command objects, and the playlist source will call duplicate() on the objects it has stored and return the newly duplicated objects.
See documentation on duplicate() for more information.

simplesect.para: playlist.xml, sbLibraryPage.xul, duplicate
